snippet: President Obama has warned Russia that “there will be costs” for a military intervention in Ukraine. But the U.S. has few options for imposing such costs, and recent history has shown that Russia has been willing to absorb any such fallout.
abstract: News analysis; United States has few palatable options for punishing Russia's military intervention in Ukraine, despite Pres Obama's warning of consequences; recent history has shown that Russia has been willing to pay the price when it considers its interests are at stake.
lead_paragraph: President Obama has warned Russia that “there will be costs” for a military intervention in Ukraine. But the U.S. has few options for imposing such costs, and recent history has shown that Russia has been willing to absorb any such fallout.

headline.main: Making Russia Pay? It’s Not So Simple
headline.print_headline: Russia to Pay? Not So Simple
